#Text=CHAPTER I.
#Text=A NOVEL CASE
#Text=“ Talking of sudden disappearances the one you mention of Hannah in that Leavenworth case of ours , is not the only remarkable one which has come under my direct notice .

#Text=Indeed , I know of another that in some respects , at least , surpasses that in points of interest , and if you will promise not to inquire into the real names of the parties concerned , as the affair is a secret , I will relate you my experience regarding it . ”

#Text=The speaker was Q , the rising young detective , universally acknowledged by us of the force as the most astute man for mysterious and unprecedented cases , then in the bureau , always and of course excepting Mr. Gryce ; and such a statement from him could not but arouse our deepest curiosity .

#Text=Drawing up , then , to the stove around which we were sitting in lazy enjoyment of one of those off-hours so dear to a detective ’s heart , we gave with alacrity the required promise ; and settling himself back with the satisfied air of a man who has a good story to tell that does not entirely lack certain points redounding to his own credit , he began :

#Text=I was one Sunday morning loitering at the -- -- - Precinct Station , when the door opened and a respectable-looking middle-aged woman came in , whose agitated air at once attracted my attention .
#Text=Going up to her , I asked her what she wanted .
#Text=“ A detective , ” she replied , glancing cautiously about on the faces of the various men scattered through the room .

#Text=“ I do n’t wish anything said about it , but a girl disappeared from our house last night , and” -- she stopped here , her emotion seeming to choke her -- “and I want some one to look her up , ” she went on at last with the most intense emphasis .
#Text=“ A girl ? what kind of a girl ; and what house do you mean when you say our house ? ”
#Text=She looked at me keenly before replying .
#Text=“ You are a young man , ” said she ;
#Text=“ is n’t there some one here more responsible than yourself that I can talk to ? ”
#Text=I shrugged my shoulders and beckoned to Mr. Gryce who was just then passing .
#Text=She at once seemed to put confidence in him .
#Text=Drawing him aside , she whispered a few low eager words which I could not hear .

#Text=He listened nonchalantly for a moment but suddenly made a move which I knew indicated strong and surprised interest , though from his face -- but you know what Gryce ’s face is . I was about to walk off , convinced he had got hold of something he would prefer to manage himself , when the Superintendent came in .
#Text=“ Where is Gryce ? ” asked he ;
#Text=“ tell him I want him . ”
#Text=Mr. Gryce heard him and hastened forward .
#Text=As he passed me , he whispered , “ Take a man and go with this woman ; look into matters and send me word if you want me ; I will be here for two hours . ”
#Text=I did not need a second permission .
#Text=Beckoning to Harris , I reapproached the woman .
#Text=“ Where do you come from , ” said I , “ I am to go back with you and investigate the affair it seems . ”
#Text=“ Did he say so ? ” she asked , pointing to Mr. Gryce who now stood with his back to us busily talking with the Superintendent .
#Text=I nodded , and she at once moved towards the door .
#Text=“ I come from No. -- --

#Text=Second Avenue : Mr. Blake ’s house , ” she whispered , uttering a name so well known , I at once understood Mr. Gryce ’s movement of sudden interest “ A girl -- one who sewed for us -- disappeared last night in a way to alarm us very much .
#Text=She was taken from her room -- ”

#Text=“ Yes , ” she cried vehemently , seeing my look of sarcastic incredulity , “ taken from her room ; she never went of her own accord ; and she must be found if I spend every dollar of the pittance I have laid up in the bank against my old age . ”
#Text=Her manner was so intense , her tone so marked and her words so vehement , I at once and naturally asked if the girl was a relative of hers that she felt her abduction so keenly .
#Text=“ No , ” she replied , “ not a relative , but , ” she went on , looking every way but in my face , “ a very dear friend -- a -- a -- protegee , I think they call it , of mine ; I -- I --
#Text=She must be found , ” she again reiterated .
#Text=We were by this time in the street .
#Text=“ Nothing must be said about it , ” she now whispered , catching me by the arm .
#Text=“ I told him so , ” nodding back to the building from which we had just issued , “ and he promised secrecy .
#Text=It can be done without folks knowing anything about it , ca n’t it ? ”
#Text=“ What ? ” I asked .
#Text=“ Finding the girl . ”
#Text=“ Well , ” said I , “ we can tell you better about that when we know a few more of the facts .
#Text=What is the girl ’s name and what makes you think she did n’t go out of the house-door of her own accord ? ”
#Text=“ Why , why , everything .
#Text=She was n’t the person to do it ; then the looks of her room , and --
#Text=They all got out of the window , ” she cried suddenly , “ and went away by the side gate into -- -- Street . ”
#Text=“ They ?
#Text=Who do you mean by they ? ”
#Text=“ Why , whoever they were who carried her off . ”
#Text=I could not suppress the “ bah ! ” that rose to my lips .
#Text=Mr. Gryce might have been able to , but I am not Gryce .
